item.title: What to know about Iran's strike on Israel; Jury selection begins for Trump trial
item.description: Iran strikes Israel in retaliation for an attack that killed top Iranian officers at an Iranian consulate in Syria. Former President Donald Trump's hush money trial is set to begin Monday in New York.

item.title: Sudan's conflict hits the 1-year mark, sparking fears of repeated atrocities
item.description: Since fighting broke out between the Sudanese Armed Forces and rebel paramilitaries a year ago, experts estimate over 14,000 people have been killed and millions displaced and facing starvation.
item.content:encoded:

item.title: Gay people often have older brothers. Why? And does it matter?
item.description: Studies worldwide show that queer people tend to have more older brothers than other kinds of siblings. Justin Torres, a queer novelist and the youngest of three brothers, asks: Should it matter?

item.description: As gun violence spiked in Philadelphia after the pandemic, some residents and nonprofits banded together to help victims.

item.title: Lightning, rains kill 36 people in Pakistan
item.description: Lightning and heavy rains have killed at least 36 people, mostly farmers, across Pakistan in the past three days, as authorities in the country's southwest declared a state of emergency.

item.title: Trump's criminal trial, a first for a former president, begins Monday
item.description: For the first time in U.S. history, a former president will sit in a courtroom for the first day of his criminal trial. It kicks off with an 18-person jury selection. A decision could come by summer.
item.content:encoded:

item.title: Growing up, he struggled to read. Then a young teacher saw his potential
item.description: Juleus Ghunta is a published children's author and award-winning poet. But growing up, he could barely read. That was until a teacher saw his potential.

item.title: His story inspired 'Hotel Rwanda.' Now he's speaking out against the government
item.description: Paul Rusesabagina, whose life inspired the movie Hotel Rwanda, and his daughter, Anaïse Kanimba, have been vocal critics of Rwanda's current president, Paul Kagame.
